text: AI researchers these days have so many
amazing new ideas to bring AI from the
lab into the real world to do that we
need enormous amounts of compute project
Saba is showing up at just the right
time to help us do
that project saber is a joint initiative
between AWS and Nvidia to build one of
the world's largest AI supercomputers
with over 20,000 Grace Blackwell gpus
all running within AWS data centers
Nvidia and AWS have a long-standing
history of deep technical co-innovation
this firstof its- kind supercomputer is
being built using the new envidia gb200
Envy link 72 a system featuring fifth
generation Envy link which connects
10,000 Nvidia graay CPUs to the gpus and
it's capable of 414 aof flops of compute
project Sab has hosted exclusively on
AWS via djx Cloud project sa comes with
many engineering challenges because
we're really pushing the boundaries of
what's been possible in AI the move from
our current 8 gpus in a single
peer-to-peer EnV link mesh or single
server to 72 gpus is an order of
magnitude increase in just one product
generation ultimately our collaboration
will democratize access for any
researcher to supercomputing researchers
can run short bursts of exaflop scale
compute to solve The World's Hardest
problems such as nvidia's Earth 2
climate prediction creating digital
twins for manufacturing and Robotics
designing the next generation of
autonomous Vehicle Systems or drug
Discovery to bring treatments to
patients living with hard-to treat
diseases I've been doing AI research on
AWS for over 10 years and because of
that experience I have confidence that
AWS will continue to provide highly
scalable reliable infastructure that we
need for tomorrow's generative AI
[Music]
